info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 03 at 4:57PM CDT until August 03 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM CDT FOR WESTERN MADISON COUNTY IN SOUTHWESTERN ILLINOIS...EAST CENTRAL ST. CHARLES AND EASTERN ST. LOUIS COUNTIES IN EAST CENTRAL MISSOURI... At 457 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over South Roxana, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Broadcast media. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Granite City, Alton, Edwardsville, Godfrey, Glen Carbon, Wood River, Bethalto, Pontoon Beach, Madison, Spanish Lake, East Alton, South Roxana, Roxana, Hartford, West Alton, Dorsey, Rosewood Heights, Glasgow Village, Poag and Kuhn. This also includes Confluence State Park. This includes Interstate 55 in Illinois near exit 23. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
